column1: Inflammation of the Sac Surrounding the Joint - Bursitis
column2: Beverly M., 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking lodine now for approx. 4 weeks and it has worked wonderfully to help alleviate my pain from severe osteoarthritis of the hip with trochanteric bursitis.  I was previously on ibuprofen 800 mg. every 8 hours.  This works much better, however I do make sure that I eat with the medicine and drink plenty of water when I take it.  We'll see how the long term outcome is.

column1: Joint Damage causing Pain and Loss of Function
column2: Inflamed, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been using Lodine for 2 months for shoulder inflammation due to multi-directional instability in the joint.  Pain relief began within 2 days allowing me to tolerate physical therapy much better.

column2: Pat828, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I took it initially because my knee (broken cartilage) was swollen and painful.  Lodine really helped tremendously.  However, Lodine turned on me.  I am now quite ill from the effects of it.  I have improved some since getting off of it.  In one week I will be having an endoscopy and colonoscopy to see what is wrong inside me.  If you are going to take this medication, please be aware that it can cause all kinds of problems.  My symptoms are diarrhea (4 months now), indigestion, bloating, gas, asthma, wheezing, stomach pain, trouble swallowing pills, nausea, and bad taste in my mouth. I had been on this for 8 months and then all of a sudden I got all kinds of symptoms that no one seemed to be able to figure out.  I went to a specialist who recognized it right away.  I now am praying that whatever problems I am experiencing can be corrected.  Please be careful!

column2: Lacey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 2 days of taking this medication, I woke up with the worse headache of my life. I could not do anything to releive the pain. It was TERRIBLE!!! I thought that I was having an anuerysm. I live in Houston and had pull over on a major highway to throw-up. When I finally got home, I threw-up 2 more times and my headache finally eased off later on that evening. I actually flushed the medication down the toilet. I don't recommend this medication to anyone.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

column2: darkdancer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
